clinical_study.brief_title: Adequate Additional Bronchial Cuff Volume to Achieve Blood-tight Seal After Air-tight Seal in Double Lumen Tube

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to find the adequate additional bronchial cuff volume after achievement of air-tight seal, that can achieve blood-tight seal(preventing leakage of blood through cuff) in double lumen tube

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: leakage of autologus blood through bronchial cuff
primary_outcome.time_frame: 10, 20, 30 minutes after dripping of blood around bronchial cuff

clinical_study.condition: Preventing Blood Leakage of Bronchial Cuff

arm_group.description: patients are assigned to 35 Fr, 37 Fr, 39 Fr double lumen tube group according to their left main bronchus diameter measured by preoperative chest CT, to minimize difference between main bronchus diameter and bronchial tip diameter of double lumen tube

intervention.description: additional bronchial cuff volume is decided according to up-and-down biased coin design sequential method, by incremental volume of 0.1 ml

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing thoracic surgery under left lower decubitus position, using left sided double lumen tube
- patient's left main bronchus size adequate for 35Fr, 37 Fr, 39 Fr double lumen tube
Exclusion Criteria:
- dislocation or great movement of double lumen tube depth
